<---# name: Docker Container (running Hello World!) - execute walk through can be used on local machine with Docker and Powershell #Containers are instances of images. Images are frozen on the container prior to deployment. #find your docker images, as a list---> docker image ls <---#dockerfile is your recipe and looks a bit like this---> FROM : RUN CMD <---find your containers, as a list---> docker container ls -a <---now remove hello-world. if you have a lot of containers; try---> docker container ls -a | grep hello-world
